page.title: 12Traffic Survey in Dalkeith
page.content:
The need for a decrease in the amount of traffic travelling through Dalkeith perhaps brought about by the construction of a bypass, was the factor leading to this survey. The group had to count the vehicular traffic coming into and going out of Dalkeith in one and a half hour period, 9.30 to 11.00 am on Friday 24 May 1985. The group had to cover 5 points, 3 of which are very busy being on 2 of the main roads leading into England, the A68 and the A7.
During the survey period 900 vehicles came into Dalkeith and 892 went out which gives and estimate of 1 vehicle travelling in or out every 1 second.
